definition: Qi, a Zhou Dynasty vassal state/surname Qi

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: To listen to adults, this is what we often say medlar.
sentences.chinese: 听大人们说，这就是我们常说的枸杞子。

sentences.english: Chinese Wolfberry nourishes the liver and kidney.
Varieties of factors that influenced the low-sugar jam of the fruit of Chinese wolfberry browning were studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了影响低糖枸杞子果酱色泽褐变的诸因素。

sentences.english: Wolfberry can make tea to drink, have a strong medicinal value.
sentences.chinese: 枸杞子可以泡茶喝，有很强的药用价值。

sentences.english: Medlar can be drinking tea, have a strong medicinal value.
sentences.chinese: 枸杞子可以泡茶喝，有很强的药用价值。

definition: huangqi/milk vetch root (used in TCM)/Astragalus membranaceus or Astragalus mongholicus
Gorgon fruit/Semen euryales (botany)/see also 雞頭米|鸡头米[ji1 tou2 mi3]
Epimedium, genus of herbaceous flowering plant, cultivated in the Far East as aphrodisiac/also called barrenwort or horny goatweed (said to resemble crushed goat's testicles)
dodder (Cuscuta sinensis, a parasitic vine with seeds used in medicine)
dwarf lilyturf (Ophiopogon japonicus), its tuber used in TCM
